importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The date when Marc Benioff publicly apologized for his comments about the National Guard being sent to San Francisco.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The period during which Benioff made controversial comments and faced backlash, culminating in his apology on October 17, 2025.

keyTakeAways: Marc Benioff, CEO of Salesforce, initially suggested President Donald Trump should deploy the National Guard to San Francisco during the Dreamforce conference, sparking widespread criticism.

Benioff later apologized, stating that his earlier comments were made 'out of abundance of caution' and that he does not believe the National Guard is needed in San Francisco after speaking with local officials.
The Dreamforce event, which drew tens of thousands, occurred during the time of the controversy and is cited as the context for Benioff’s comment.
Benioff’s support for federal troop deployment in Democrat-led cities aligns with broader tech billionaire alignment with President Trump in the second term.
Venture capitalist Ron Conway resigned from the Salesforce Foundation board in response to Benioff’s comments, indicating internal dissent.

Internal Salesforce documents revealed that the company had previously pitched AI tools to Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE), suggesting support for increased deportations and ICE investigations, raising ethical and political concerns.
Salesforce has a history of contracting with U.S. government agencies, including ICE under previous administrations such as Obama and Biden.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Marc Benioff, CEO of Salesforce, faced backlash for suggesting President Donald Trump deploy the National Guard to San Francisco during the Dreamforce conference, which drew tens of thousands. He later apologized, stating that he no longer believes federal troops are needed and that his initial comment was made out of caution. The controversy also revealed that Salesforce had previously pitched AI tools to Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE), raising ethical concerns. This incident reflects a broader trend of tech billionaires aligning with Trump’s policies, prompting internal dissent, such as the resignation of venture capitalist Ron Conway from the Salesforce Foundation board.
title: Marc Benioff apologizes for suggesting National Guard be sent to San Francisco
